text: The Fall of Babylon
The oracle of \add the\add* wilderness of \add the\add* sea:
As storm winds passing over in the Negev,
⸤it comes⸥\f + \fr 21:1 \ft Literally “to come” \f* from \add the\add* desert,
from a frightful land.
A hard revelation is told to me;
the treacherous deals treacherously,
and the destroyer destroys.
Go up, Elam;
lay siege, Media!
I put an end to all of her sighing.
Therefore my loins are filled \add with\add* anguish;
pangs have seized me, like \add the\add* pangs of a woman giving birth.
I am ⸤too bent to hear⸥,\f + \fr 21:3 \ft Literally “bent from hearing,” which could also mean “bent because of what I heard” \f*
I am ⸤too dismayed to see⸥.\f + \fr 21:3 \ft Literally “dismayed from seeing,” which could also mean “dismayed because of what I saw” \f*
My ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 21:4 \ft Literally “heart” \f* staggers; fear terrifies me;
the twilight ⸤I desired⸥\f + \fr 21:4 \ft Literally “of my desire” \f* ⸤brought⸥\f + \fr 21:4 \ft Literally “put” \f* me fear.
Set out the table in order!
Spread out the rugs!\f + \fr 21:5 \ft Hebrew “rug” \f*
Eat! drink!
Rise up, commanders;
smear\f + \fr 21:5 \ft That is, prepare with oil \f* \add the\add* shield!
For the Lord said this to me:
“Go, set \add a\add* watchman in position.
He must announce what he sees.
When\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Or “And” \f* he sees riders,\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Hebrew “rider” \f*
a pair of horsemen,
riders\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Hebrew “rider” \f* of donkeys,\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Hebrew “donkey” \f*
riders\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Hebrew “rider” \f* of camels,\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Hebrew “camel” \f*
⸤then⸥\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Or “and” \f* he must listen attentively,
paying attention, paying ⸤special⸥\f + \fr 21:7 \ft Literally “much” \f* attention.”
Then\f + \fr 21:8 \ft Or “And” \f* \add the\add* ⸤watchman⸥\f + \fr 21:8 \ft Literally “lion” \f* called,
“Lord, I \add am\add* standing on \add the\add* watchtower continually by day,
and I \add am\add* standing at my post ⸤throughout⸥\f + \fr 21:8 \ft Literally “all of” \f* the night.
And look \add at\add* this! A man’s a chariot \add is\add* coming,
a pair of horsemen!”
Then\f + \fr 21:9 \ft Or “and” \f* he responded and said,
“It has fallen! Babylon has fallen!
And all the images of her gods are\f + \fr 21:9 \ft Hebrew “is” \f* smashed on the ground!”
My downtrodden people
and the son of my threshing floor,
I will announce to you what I have heard from Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel.
Oracle regarding Dumah
The oracle of Dumah:
\add One is\add* calling to me from Seir,
“Watchman, what ⸤of⸥\f + \fr 21:11 \ft Literally “from” \f* \add the\add* night?
Watchman, what ⸤of⸥\f + \fr 21:11 \ft Literally “from” \f* \add the\add* night?”
\add The\add* watchman says,
“Morning comes,
and also \add the\add* night.
If you will inquire, inquire;
⸤come back again⸥.”\f + \fr 21:12 \ft Literally “return come” \f*
Oracle against Arabia
An oracle ⸤concerning⸥\f + \fr 21:13 \ft Literally “in” \f* Arabia:
You will spend the night in the thicket in a desert-plateau,\f + \fr 21:13 \ft The Hebrew for “in a desert-plateau” is the same as for “concerning Arabia” in the preceding line \f*
caravans of Dedanites.
⸤When you happen to meet⸥\f + \fr 21:14 \ft Literally “Toward encountering” \f* \add the\add* thirsty, bring water.
Inhabitants of the land of Tema came to meet \add the\add* fugitive with his bread.
For they have fled from \add the\add* swords,
from \add the\add* drawn sword and \add the\add* bent bow,
and from \add the\add* heaviness of \add the\add* battle.
For the Lord said this to me:
“⸤In one more year⸥,\f + \fr 21:16 \ft Literally “In yet a year” \f* like \add the\add* years of a hired worker,
all the glory of Kedar will come to an end.
And the remainder of the number of the bows\f + \fr 21:17 \ft Hebrew “bow” \f* of the warriors of the sons of Kedar will be few.”
For Yahweh, the God of Israel, has spoken.
